text: 国問病か
translation: The Black Scrawl disease?

text: いつからだ
translation: Since when?

text: 変な咳をするようになったのは / 一ヶ月前
translation: She started having that strange cough... / one month ago.
grammar: 〜ようになる indicates a change of state ('came to do', 'started doing').

text: その病にかかった人間は / 全身に黒い文字のような文様が広がり
translation: Those who contract this disease... / have black letter-like patterns spread across their entire body.

text: やがて死に至る / うん、知ってる
translation: ...and eventually leads to death. / Yeah, I know.
grammar: 〜に至る is a formal expression meaning 'to lead to' or 'to result in'.

text: ヨナ
translation: Yona...

text: 今はそっとしておけ
translation: Leave her alone for now.
grammar: 〜ておけ is the imperative form of 〜ておく (to leave as is).

text: 今はそっとしておけ
translation: Leave her alone for now.

text: どうしてヨナなんだ
translation: Why Yona?

text: 何も悪いことしてないのに / どうしてヨナが
translation: She hasn't done anything wrong... / Why does it have to be Yona?
grammar: 〜のに expresses frustration or regret ('even though', 'despite').

text: 僕たち兄弟ばかり / なんでこんな目に
translation: Why is it always us siblings... / Why do we have to suffer like this?
grammar: こんな目に遭う means 'to experience this kind of hardship'.

text: 我とて助ける方法があれば助けてやりたいのだが
translation: Even I would want to help if there were a way.
grammar: 我とて is archaic for 'even I'. 〜てやりたいのだが expresses a wish with regret.

text: よう無事だったのか / 東門から出たと聞いて心配
translation: Oh, you're safe! / I was worried when I heard you went out the east gate.

text: なんだその本は / あ、これはその
translation: What's that book? / Oh, this is, uh...

text: 我は偉大なるシロの書であるぞ
translation: I am the great Book of Shiro!

text: 敬ってもらって構わんぞ / へえ、シロの書って喋るんだな / 知らなかったよ
translation: You may show me respect. / Huh, so the Book of Shiro can talk. / I didn't know that.
grammar: 構わん is archaic for 構わない (don't mind).

text: え、シロのこと知ってるんですか
translation: Eh? You know about Shiro?

text: 今歌ってた歌に出てくるんだよ / シロの書って
translation: It appears in the song I was just singing. / The Book of Shiro.

text: 歌?
translation: A song?

text: そう、村に昔から伝わる古の歌さ
translation: Yes, an ancient song that's been passed down in the village.

vocabulary.meaning: to be handed down, to be transmitted

text: 古い言葉だからね / 何言ってるかわからないだろうけど
translation: It's in an old language, / so you probably can't understand what it's saying.

text: その歌、どんな意味があるんですか?
translation: What does that song mean?

text: 意味って言われてもな / あんまり詳しくはないんだが
translation: Even if you ask about the meaning... / I don't know it in detail.

text: いつかこの世に黒の書が舞い降り
translation: One day, the Black Book will descend upon this world...

text: 病をまき散らす
translation: ...and spread disease.

text: だがそれに抗うシロの書が世界を救うって感じかな
translation: But the Book of Shiro will resist it and save the world... something like that.

text: どうしたんだ一体
translation: What's wrong with you?

vocabulary.meaning: on earth, what in the world

text: いや何でもないです
translation: No, it's nothing.

text: それでどうやってシロの書は世界を救うことになってるんですか
translation: So how is the Book of Shiro supposed to save the world?

vocabulary.meaning: is supposed to, is said to

grammar: 〜ことになっている means 'it is decided/supposed that ~'.

text: さあね 私もそこまで詳しく理解して歌ってるわけじゃないし
translation: Who knows? I don't sing it with that deep an understanding either.
grammar: 〜わけじゃない means 'it's not that ~' or 'it doesn't mean that ~'.

text: そうなんだ
translation: I see.

text: しょげるなよ 物知りポポルに聞いてみたらどうだ
translation: Don't be down. Why don't you ask the knowledgeable Popola?

vocabulary.meaning: to be downcast, to be dejected

grammar: 〜てみたらどうだ is a suggestion meaning 'how about trying to ~'.

text: 何か知ってるかもしれないし
translation: She might know something.

text: そうですね どうもありがとう
translation: You're right. Thank you very much.

text: ヨナちゃんのことは聞いてるわ 本当に何て言ったらいいか
translation: I've heard about Yona. I really don't know what to say...

vocabulary.reading: なんていったらいいか

text: そのことでお願いがあるんです デボルさんが歌っていた
translation: About that, I have a request. The song that Devola was singing...

text: 古の歌について教えてもらえませんか
translation: Could you tell me about the ancient song?

vocabulary.word: 教えてもらえませんか
vocabulary.reading: おしえてもらえませんか

grammar: 〜てもらえませんか is a very polite way to make a request.

text: それはシロの書?
translation: Is that the Book of Shiro?

text: シロを知ってるんですか? / 話が早そうだ
translation: You know about Shiro? / This should be quick then.

vocabulary.meaning: to get to the point quickly

grammar: 話が早い is an idiom meaning 'to understand quickly' or 'things are progressing fast'.

text: 古の歌ね
translation: The ancient song, huh.

text: 黒の書が世界に最悪をもたらした時
translation: When the Black Book brings the worst upon the world...

text: 白の書が現れ / 封印されし言葉で
translation: ...the White Book will appear, / and with Sealed Verses...
grammar: 封印されし is an archaic form of 封印された (sealed).

text: 黒の書を下ろし / 最悪を消し去るって言われてるの
translation: ...it will bring down the Black Book / and eliminate the worst. That's what's said.

text: 封印されし言葉って / 正確な記録が残っていないので / よくはわからないけど / 何か魔法のようなものらしいわ
translation: As for the Sealed Verses... / there are no accurate records left, / so I don't really know, / but it seems to be some kind of magic.

text: そうかそうだったんだ
translation: I see, so that's how it was.

text: ど、どうしたの?
translation: Wh-what's wrong?

text: シロの書が病を消し去るって / 古の歌に書いてあったんですよね
translation: It was written in the ancient song that the Book of Shiro will eliminate the disease, right?

text: そして封印されし言葉
translation: And the Sealed Verses...

text: あの神殿で石像を倒した時に我が吸ったものが封印されし言葉ということか
translation: So what I absorbed when we defeated the statue in that shrine was a Sealed Verse?

text: そうだよシロシロさえいればヨダの病気は治るんだ
translation: That's right! As long as we have Shiro, Yona's disease can be cured!
grammar: 〜さえいれば means 'as long as there is ~'.

text: そんなこれは昔の言い伝えなんじゃ
translation: But this is just an old legend...

text: だけどシロの書はこうやって実在してるんです
translation: But the Book of Shiro exists right here!

text: 病を治す言い伝えもきっと本当だ
translation: The legend about curing the disease must be true too!

text: しかし肝心の黒の書のありかがわからぬ
translation: However, we don't know where the crucial Black Book is.
grammar: わからぬ is an archaic form of わからない.

text: それは記録には書かれていないわ
translation: That isn't written in the records.

text: 封印されし言葉も一つとは限らないし
translation: And the Sealed Verses might not be just one.
grammar: 〜とは限らない means 'not necessarily ~' or 'it's not always the case that ~'.

text: だが魔物たちと封印されし言葉は
translation: But the monsters and the Sealed Verses...

text: 浅からぬ関係があるようだな / じゃあ僕が手当たり次第に魔物を殺していくよ
translation: ...seem to have a deep connection. / Then I'll kill monsters indiscriminately!
grammar: 浅からぬ is an archaic negative meaning 'not shallow' = 'deep'.

text: そんな危ないこと
translation: That's so dangerous...

text: 寮をこなして質を得るつもりか
translation: You plan to gain quality through quantity?

text: 無謀な策だ / ここにじっとして何もしないよりましだよ
translation: That's a reckless plan. / It's better than just sitting here doing nothing!
grammar: 〜よりまし means 'better than ~'.

text: 僕は行くヨナのために / でも
translation: I'm going. For Yona's sake. / But...

text: そう
translation: I see.

text: なら仕方ないわね
translation: Then it can't be helped.

text: 最近 / 崖の村という場所で魔物が出ていると聞いたわ
translation: Recently, / I heard monsters have been appearing at a place called the Aerie.

text: 北平原の橋の修理が終わったらしいから / そこを渡っていけばいけると思う
translation: The bridge on the Northern Plains seems to be repaired, / so you should be able to get there by crossing it.

text: 地図に書いておいたわ
translation: I've marked it on the map.
grammar: 〜ておく means to do something in advance or for later use.

text: もしかしたら封印されし言葉はそこにあるかもしれない
translation: Maybe the Sealed Verses are there.

text: 村長の家を訪ねてみるといいわ
translation: You should try visiting the village chief's house.
grammar: 〜てみるといい is a suggestion meaning 'you should try doing ~'.

text: 崖の村で一番高いところにある建物よ
translation: It's the building at the highest point in the Aerie.

text: わかった
translation: Got it.

text: 不思議なところにある村戸 / 村長の家はどういうルートで行けばよいのだ
translation: A village in a strange place... / What route should we take to the village chief's house?

text: ここは村長の家か
translation: Is this the village chief's house?

text: 誰だ
translation: Who's there?

text: あ、僕たちは / 帰れ / よそこなら帰ってくれ / 話を
translation: Ah, we are... / Go away! / If you're an outsider, please leave! / But we need to talk...

text: いいから帰るんだ / この村から出て行ってくれ / 話にならぬ
translation: Just leave! / Get out of this village! / There's no point talking.
grammar: 話にならぬ is archaic for 話にならない (there's no point talking).

text: どうやらここには雑魚しかおらぬようだ
translation: It seems there are only weaklings here.
grammar: おらぬ is archaic for いない (not exist).

text: 封印されし言葉はないようだ / そうだね
translation: It doesn't seem like the Sealed Verses are here. / Yeah.

text: ポポルさんのところに戻って情報を集めよう
translation: Let's go back to Popola's place and gather information.

text: なんだろう
translation: What could that be?

text: 綺麗な花だな / 伝説の花だ
translation: What a beautiful flower. / It's a legendary flower.

text: 魅了されるのも無理はない
translation: It's no wonder you're captivated by it.
grammar: 〜も無理はない means 'it's no wonder that ~' or 'it's understandable that ~'.

text: え、じゃあこれが / ヨナの集めたかった
translation: Wait, so this is... / the one Yona wanted to collect...

text: その花に触るな
translation: Don't touch that flower!
grammar: 〜な is the plain prohibitive form (don't do ~).

text: あの女の人下着しかつけてないよ / たわけがもっと他に見るべき場所があろう
translation: That woman is only wearing underwear! / You fool, there are more important things to look at!
grammar: たわけ is an archaic/old-fashioned word for 'fool'. あろう is archaic for あるだろう.

text: あの人魔物
translation: That person... is a monster?

text: やはりこうなるのか
translation: So it's come to this after all.

text: やったか
translation: Did we get it?

text: 아아악
translation: (Transcription error - Korean text)

text: 아악
translation: (Transcription error - Korean text)

text: 何? / あの音は / あやつも魔法を使えるのか
translation: What? / That sound... / Can that one use magic too?
grammar: あやつ is an archaic/rough way to say 'that person/thing'.

text: また魔物 / 魔物が魔物を攻撃してる
translation: More monsters! / A monster is attacking other monsters!

text: 邪魔をするな!今は奴を倒す方が先だ!
translation: Don't get in my way! Defeating that thing comes first!

text: どうなら我らのことは眼中にないようだな / おう
translation: It seems we're not in their sight. / Yeah.
grammar: 眼中にない is an idiom meaning 'to have no regard for' or 'to be beneath notice'.

text: 衝撃波に気をつけ! / 気を見て近づくしかないか
translation: Watch out for the shockwave! / I'll just have to watch for an opening and get close.
grammar: 〜しかない means 'have no choice but to ~'.

text: 何か吐き出しよったぞ / あれは何だ
translation: It spit something out! / What is that?

text: この丸いのも魔物
translation: These round things are monsters too?

text: こんな大きい魔物がいるの / 今までの奴とは架空が違うぞ / 気を引き締め
translation: There's a monster this big? / It's on a different level from the ones before! / Stay focused!
grammar: 気を引き締める means 'to brace oneself' or 'to stay focused'.

text: あ、ありがとう / 邪魔だ
translation: Th-thank you. / You're in the way.

text: 見ろ、文様が消えていく
translation: Look, the patterns are disappearing!
grammar: 〜ていく indicates an action continuing or progressing away.

text: この人、人間だよね? / 半分はな / いわゆる魔物つきというやつらしい
translation: This person is human, right? / Half of her is. / Apparently it's what's called being possessed by a monster.

text: そう悪いことしちゃったな / 僕てっきり魔物だとばかり
translation: I see... I did something bad. / I was completely sure she was a monster.
grammar: てっきり〜だとばかり思っていた means 'I was completely sure that ~'.

text: とにかくこの人を助けなきゃ
translation: Anyway, we have to help this person!

text: あ、気がついた
translation: Ah, she's awake.

text: 貴様ら
translation: You bastards...
grammar: 貴様 is a very rude way to say 'you', often used in anger.

text: さっきはごめんなさい / てっきり魔物だとばかり
translation: I'm sorry about earlier. / I was completely sure you were a monster.

text: 半分は本当に魔物だ / さっさと出ていけ
translation: Half of me really is a monster. / Now get lost.

text: 我らはお前を解放し謝罪した
translation: We freed you and apologized.

text: 名前くらい名乗らぬか
translation: Won't you at least tell us your name?
grammar: 名乗らぬか is an archaic form of 名乗らないか (won't you introduce yourself).

text: いいよシロ / あんなに激しく戦った後だもの / 疲れてるんだきっと
translation: It's okay, Shiro. / After fighting that intensely, / she must be tired.

text: カイネ / 私の名前だ
translation: Kainé. / That's my name.

text: その名 / 村で聞いたことがある
translation: That name... / I've heard it in the village.
grammar: 〜たことがある indicates having experienced something before.

text: もういいだろう / 私に関わってもろくなことがない
translation: That's enough. / Nothing good comes from getting involved with me.
grammar: ろくなことがない is an idiom meaning 'nothing good comes of it'.

text: 帰れ / これだけは言っておく
translation: Leave. / But I'll tell you just this.

text: 奴は私の獲物だ / 絶対に手を出すな
translation: That thing is my prey. / Don't you dare touch it.
grammar: 手を出すな means 'don't lay a hand on' or 'don't interfere'.

text: やれやれ / 巨大魔物に魔物付きか
translation: Good grief. / A giant monster and a possessed person.

text: 綺麗だけどなんだか近寄り難い人だったね
translation: She was beautiful but somehow hard to approach.
grammar: 〜難い (がたい) means 'hard to do ~'.
